00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  *  @brief   Bottleneck biconnected spanning subgraph problem implemenation.
00003  *
00004  *  Implemenation of the bottleneck biconnected spanning subgraph problem
00005  *  (BBSSP) that's used as a lower bound for the Bottleneck TSP objective
00006  *  value.
00007  *
00008  *  @author  John LaRusic
00009  *  @ingroup lib
00010  ****************************************************************************/
00011 #include "common.h"
00012 #include "lb.h"
00013 
00014 /****************************************************************************
00015  * Private function prototypes
00016  ****************************************************************************/
00017 /**
00018  *  @brief  Recursively searches for articulation points in the graph using
00019  *          only costs less than or equal to 'max_cost' out from the given
00020  *          node.
00021  *  @param  problem [in] problem data structure
00022  *  @param  min_cost [in] the smallest cost to consider as being in the graph
00023  *  @param  max_cost [in] the largest cost to consider as being in the graph
00024  *  @param  node [in] the node to search outward from
00025  *  @param  depth_num [in] level at which the given node was first discovered
00026  *  @param  root_children [in] count of the number of children of the root
00027  *  @param  visited [out] indicates if a node has been visited or not
00028  *  @param  depth [out] indicates the discovery depth of a node
00029  *  @param  low [out] indicates a back edge for some descendent of a node
00030  *              (e.g. the discovery depth of the node closest to the root and
00031  *              reachable from the given node by following zero or more edges
00032  *              downward and then at most one back edge)
00033  *  @param  parent [out] indicates the closest "parent" of a node
00034  *  @param  art_point [out] indicates if the node is an articulation point
00035  */
00036 int
00037 find_art_points(arrow_problem *problem, int min_cost, int max_cost, int node,
00038                 int depth_num, int root_children, int *visited, int *depth, 
00039                 int *low, int *parent, int *art_point);
00040 
00041 
00042 /****************************************************************************
00043  * Public function implementations
00044  ****************************************************************************/
00045 int
00046 arrow_bbssp_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info, 
00047                   arrow_bound_result *result)
00048 {
00049     int ret;
00050     int low, high, median;
00051     int connected;
00052     double start_time, end_time;
00053     
00054     /* Start binary search */
00055     start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00056     low = 0;
00057     high = info->cost_list_length - 1;
00058     while(low != high)
00059     {
00060         median = ((high - low) / 2) + low;
00061         
00062         /* Determine is graph is biconnected if we consider only costs less
00063          * than or equal to the median value. */
00064         ret = arrow_bbssp_biconnected(problem, INT_MIN, 
00065                                       info->cost_list[median], &connected);
00066         
00067         if(ret == ARROW_FAILURE)
00068         {
00069             result->obj_value = -1;
00070             return ARROW_FAILURE;
00071         }  
00072         else
00073         {
00074             if(connected == ARROW_TRUE)
00075                 high = median;
00076             else
00077                 low = median + 1;
00078         }
00079     }
00080     end_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00081     
00082     /* Return the cost we converged to as the answer */
00083     if((result->obj_value == info->max_cost) && !connected)
00084         result->obj_value = -1;
00085     else
00086         result->obj_value = info->cost_list[low];
00087         
00088     result->total_time = end_time - start_time;
00089     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00090 }
00091 
00092 
00093 int
00094 arrow_bbssp_biconnected(arrow_problem *problem, int min_cost, int max_cost, 
00095                         int *result)
00096 {
00097     int ret;
00098     int u;
00099     int *visited;
00100     int *depth;
00101     int *low;
00102     int *parent;
00103     int *art_point;
00104     
00105     visited = NULL;
00106     depth = NULL;
00107     low = NULL;
00108     parent = NULL;
00109     art_point = NULL;
00110 
00111     /* Initialize all the necessary arrays */
00112     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(problem->size, &visited);
00113     if(ret == ARROW_FAILURE) goto CLEANUP; 
00114 
00115     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(problem->size, &depth);
00116     if(ret == ARROW_FAILURE) goto CLEANUP;
00117 
00118     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(problem->size, &low);
00119     if(ret == ARROW_FAILURE) goto CLEANUP;
00120 
00121     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(problem->size, &parent);
00122     if(ret == ARROW_FAILURE) goto CLEANUP;
00123 
00124     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(problem->size, &art_point);
00125     if(ret == ARROW_FAILURE) goto CLEANUP;
00126 
00127     /* Set the default values for each array */
00128     for(u = 0; u < problem->size; u++)
00129     {
00130         visited[u] = 0;
00131         depth[u] = -1;
00132         low[u] = INT_MAX;
00133         parent[u] = -1;
00134         art_point[u] = 0;
00135     }
00136 
00137     /* We start by assuming the graph is biconnected */
00138     *result = ARROW_TRUE;
00139     
00140     /* Find any and all articulation points from the first vertex */
00141     ret = find_art_points(problem, min_cost, max_cost, 0, 0, 0, visited,
00142                           depth, low, parent, art_point);
00143     
00144     /* Check for articulation points or unvisited nodes */
00145     for(u = 0; u < problem->size; u++)
00146     {
00147         if(!visited[u] || art_point[u])
00148             *result = ARROW_FALSE;
00149     }
00150     
00151 CLEANUP:
00152     if(visited != NULL) free(visited);   
00153     if(depth != NULL) free(depth);   
00154     if(low != NULL) free(low); 
00155     if(parent != NULL) free(parent);
00156     if(art_point != NULL) free(art_point);   
00157     
00158     return ret;
00159 }
00160 
00161 
00162 /****************************************************************************
00163  * Private function implementations
00164  ****************************************************************************/
00165 int
00166 find_art_points(arrow_problem *problem, int min_cost, int max_cost, int node,
00167                 int depth_num, int root_children, int *visited, int *depth, 
00168                 int *low, int *parent, int *art_point)
00169 {
00170     /* "u" is the current node, and "v" will represent adjecent nodes */
00171     int u, v;
00172     int cost, cost2;
00173 
00174     /* 
00175        Some explanation of these variables:
00176        - depth_num is the level at which we first discovered node u
00177        - visited[u] indicates if node u has been visited or not
00178        - depth[u] indicates the discovery depth of node u
00179        - low[u] = 
00180             min{d[u], d[w] |(v,w) is a back edge for some descendent v of u}
00181          i.e. the discovery depth of the vertex closest to the root and
00182          reachable from node u by following zero or more edges downward, and
00183          then at most one back edge  
00184     */
00185     u = node;
00186     visited[u] = 1;
00187     depth[u] = depth_num;
00188     low[u] = depth_num;
00189     depth_num++;
00190     
00191     /* Look at nodes adjacent to u */
00192     for(v = 0; v < problem->size; v++)
00193     {
00194         cost = problem->get_cost(problem, u, v);
00195         
00196         /* If our problem is asymmetric, then we consider a symmetric
00197            instance, taking min{C[u,v],C[v,u]} as the edge cost. */
00198         if(!problem->symmetric)
00199         {
00200             cost2 = problem->get_cost(problem, v, u);
00201             if(cost2 < cost)
00202                 cost = cost2;
00203         }
00204         
00205         if((cost >= min_cost) && (cost <= max_cost))
00206         {
00207             /* If the node has yet to be visited, mark its parent as u */
00208             if(!visited[v])
00209             {
00210                 parent[v] = u;
00211                 
00212                 /* If this is the parent, increase root_children count */
00213                 if(parent[u] == -1) root_children++;
00214                 
00215                 /* Recurse on v */
00216                 find_art_points(problem, min_cost, max_cost, v, depth_num, 
00217                                 root_children, visited, depth, low, 
00218                                 parent, art_point);
00219                 
00220                 /* Update low[u] */
00221                 if(low[v] < low[u]) low[u] = low[v];
00222                 
00223                 /* Check articulation point conditions */
00224                 if(parent[u] == -1)
00225                 {
00226                     if(root_children > 1)
00227                     {
00228                         art_point[u] = 1;
00229                     }
00230                 }
00231                 else if(low[v] >= depth[u])
00232                 {
00233                     art_point[u] = 1;
00234                 }
00235             }
00236             /* Check to see if edge is a back edge */
00237             else if(v != parent[u])
00238             {
00239                 if(depth[v] < low[u]) low[u] = depth[v];
00240             }
00241         }
00242     }
00243     
00244     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00245 }
